commits.commit_title:
capi: Fix layout of blaze_err and blaze_trace_lvl

Fixate the layout of the blaze_err and blaze_trace_lvl types to make it
well defined and more future proof. It also seems like the right thing
in terms of consistency of the code.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>

capi: Introduce blaze_err enum and blaze_err_last() function

Our fallible API functions currently simply return a pointer that can be
NULL, conveying failure but not what kind of failure. This can make it
unnecessarily hard to understand problems.
With this change we introduce the blaze_err enum, mirroring the
ErrorKind type of the Rust crate, that categorizes the error at a high
level. We also add the blaze_err_last() to the public API surfaces,
which returns the error of the last fallible API function.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>

capi: Move error functionality into module of same name

Move the error functionality into a separate module to clean up the main
lib.rs file a little bit.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
